【a.】 definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可: used when you want to give the main point of sth. 总而言之；简单地说
The link between poverty and bad health: His novels belong to a great but vanished age. They are, in short, old-fashioned.

【a.】 definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可: become involved with and try to understand sb. / sth. 与···建立密切关系；尽力理解
The link between poverty and bad health: Are you so tired that you don't have the energy to engage with your kids?

【a.】 definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可: if sb. such as a doctor or engineer is on call, they are ready to go and help whenever they are needed as part of their job （医生、工程师等）待命，随叫随到
The link between poverty and bad health: Don't worry, there is a doctor on call 24 hours a day.

【a.】 definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可: show that sth. is true or exists 见证（某事）；（为某事）证明
The link between poverty and bad health: The empty workshops bear witness to the industrial past.

undeniable: on the contrary / quite the contrary
【a.】 definitely true or certain 不可否认的；无可: used to add to a negative statement, to disagree with a negative statement by sb. else, or to answer no to a question 正相反；恰恰相反
The link between poverty and bad health: It wasn't a good thing; on the contrary it was a huge mistake.
